branches.description: Student addresses Peer
Peer addresses Student
Student addresses Adult
Adult addresses Student
Student works independently on a computing related task
Student works independently on a non-computing task
Student joins peer conversation

nodes.title: How does the interaction with the peer or adult begin or continue?

branches.description: Student clearly expresses how he or she needs help with a difficulty or problem
Student expresses a need for help, but is not explicit to the difficulty or problem
Student discusses computing (not problem solving)
Student engages in non-computing conversation
Student offers support to peer (the peer did not specifically ask for help)
Student says something that is unclear or inaudible
Peer offers self-regulation support to student
branches.aside: Describe the support in the field notes.

branches.description: Peer offers support to student who was working collaboratively on a problem or topic
Peer offers computing problem solving support to student who was working independently on a problem or topic
Peer discusses computing (not problem solving)
Peer engages student in non-computing conversation (heard on student's computer)
Peer asks student for help
Peer says something that is unclear or inaudible
Adult offers self-regulation support to student
branches.aside: Describe the support in the field notes.

branches.description: Adult offers support to student who was working collaboratively on a problem or topic
Adult offers computing problem solving support to student who was working independently on a problem or topic
Adult engages in non-computing conversation
Adult discusses computing (not problem solving)
Adult says something that is unclear or inaudible
Adult directs student to a computing task
Student's cursor stops moving for more than 30 seconds, or the student leaves station (> 30 seconds) and returns to independently work [end path]
Interaction terminates [end path]
The video record ends [end path]

nodes.title: What was the problem? (This is referring to the difficulty not the subtask)

branches.description: Difficulty or problem or topic is related to programming
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to academic content
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to navigating software
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to asset creation and management
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to general computer technology
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to multiple of the above categories
branches.aside: Indicate the relevant categories in the field notes using the following keywords: "computing/programming", "academic content", "navigating software", "asset creation/management", "general computer technology", "other"

branches.description: Other (Please add additional notes)

nodes.title: What did the interaction between the Peer or Adult and the student look like?

branches.description: Peer and student discuss the difficulty or problem
Peer and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Peer recites all steps of a solution at once (e.g. Peer does not give the student the chance to talk)
Peer recites all steps of a solution, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and no problem solving discussions are occurring
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, no problem solving discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins the discussion
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and problem solving discussions are occurring
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Peer and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and then Peer directs student to another peer or adult
Adult and student discuss the difficulty or problem
Adult and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Adult recites all steps of a solution at once
Adult recites all steps of a solution, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and no problem solving discussions are occurring
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, no problem solving discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins the discussion
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and problem solving discussions are occurring
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, problem solving discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Adult and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and then Adult directs student to another peer or adult
Peer directs student to talk to another peer or adult
Peer clearly states that he or she does not know how to help
Peer clearly states that he or she does not want to help
Adult directs student to talk to another peer or adult
Adult clearly states that he or she does not know how to help
Adult clearly states that he or she does not want to help
Student ignored or cannot hear or code student's response to peer
Student ignored or cannot hear or code student's response to adult
Peer ignored or cannot hear or code peer's response to student
Adult ignored or cannot hear or code adult's response to student
Student and peer discuss a difficulty or problem
Student and peer discuss a difficulty or problem, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Student recites all steps of a solution at once
Student recites all steps of a solution, and another person(s) joins the problem solving discussion
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, and no problem solving discussions are occurring
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, no problem solving discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins the discussion
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, and problem solving discussions are occurring
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, problem solving discussions are occurring, and another person (s) joins the problem solving discussion
Student and peer discuss a difficulty or problem, and then student directs peer to another peer or adult
Student directs peer to talk to another peer or adult
Student clearly states that he or she does not know how to help
Student clearly states that he or she does not want to help
Student's cursor stops moving for more than 30 seconds, or the student leaves station (> 30 seconds) and returns to independently work [end path]
Interaction terminates [end path]

branch_group_names: Peer - Unable or Unwilling to Help
Adult - Unable or Unwilling to Help
Student - Unable or Unwilling to Help

nodes.title: Was the problem solved or not solved? (Was the difficulty solved?)

branches.description: Problem was not solved
Problem was solved

nodes.title: What is the nature of the non problem-solving computing discussion?

branches.description: Student questions peer about something associated with peer's work
Student verbally comments about his/her own work, e.g. accomplishment
Student verbally comments about something associated with peer's work
Student expresses dissatisfaction or frustration
Student says something that is unclear or inaudible
Peer questions student about something associated with student's work
Peer verbally comments about something associated with his/her own work, e.g. accomplishment
Peer verbally comments about something associated with student's work
Peer expresses dissatisfaction or frustration
Peer says something that is unclear or inaudible

nodes.title: What is the peer/adult's response to the student's non-problem solving computing-related communication?

branches.description: Peer verbally responds to the student's comment about student's work (e.g. curiosity, excitement, or frustration)
Adult verbally responds to the student's comment about studentâ€™s work (e.g. curiosity, excitement, or frustration)
Interaction terminates [end path]
Student/peer/adult ignored or cannot hear or code the response
Student/peer/adult says something that is unclear or inaudible
Student verbally responds to the peer's comment about student's work (e.g. curiosity, excitement, or frustration)
Student offers support to peer (the peer did not specifically ask for help)

nodes.title: How did the student/peer respond to the non-computing conversation?

branches.description: Peer verbally responds to student's non-computing conversation
Adult verbally responds to student's non-computing conversation
Interaction terminates [end path]
Student/peer/adult ignores or cannot hear or code response
Peer or adult redirects student to the computing task
Student/peer/adult says something that is unclear or inaudible
Student verbally responds to peer's non-computing conversation
Student redirects peer to the computing task

nodes.title: How does the event end or continue? (Independent Path)

branches.description: Student's cursor stops moving for more than 30 seconds, or the student leaves station (> 30 seconds) and returns to independently work [end path]
branches.aside: Timestamp this code at the point where the student leaves the station or the student's cursor stops moving. Begin the next path at the point where the student returns to their station or the cursor begins moving.

branches.description: The video record ends [end path]
Student independently solves a problem previously discussed during an interaction [end path]
Interaction begins [end path]
branches.aside: Timestamp this code when the interaction begins. Create a new path for the interaction and start it at the same timestamp.

branches.description: Student switches to a computing related task while working independently [self loop]
Student switches to a non-computing task while working independently [self loop]
